title: "The Modern Conductor" book cover face
content:
A quite distinctive italic serif face. Interestingly, the cap height is only slightly higher than the x-height.

Perhaps something ITC-ish? It seems to have that overall feeling...

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317202318im_/http:/typophile.com/files/themodernconductor_5908.jpg)

Font: 

 Adobe Marigold 

Solved By: 

 [DPape](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317202318/http:/typophile.com/user/3945 "View user profile.")
author: rjmcconnell

comments.content: Arthur Baker's [Marigold](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317202318/http:/old.myfonts.com/fonts/mti/marigold/). His calligraphic style is so distinctive that his fonts are, for me at least, among the easiest to recognize.
